subject: The holiday season is upon us!
header: 'Tis the season...for Advent calendars, apparently. Take a look at special coverage of those in this week's issue, along with more LPW reports and other goodies!

entries.title: Perl 6 Advent Calendar
entries.text: Every year since 2009--no fancy calendar, just great blog entries every year in the weeks leading up to Christmas.

entries.title: Mojolicious Advent Calendar
entries.author: joel_berger
entries.text: Joel has started a new blog for Mojolicious, and is kicking it off in grand style, with an Advent calendar.

entries.title: Dancer Advent Calendar
entries.text: They are a couple of days behind as I write this, but the Dancer team has produced an Advent calendar since 2010.

entries.title: My first tech conference: London Perl Workshop 2017
entries.author: thomas_waddle
entries.text: Thomas attends his first LPW, and writes about it for Eligo's blog.

entries.title: London Perl Workshop Report
entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Dave had a great day at the LPW, and tells us all about it.

entries.title: LPW Time
entries.author: mark_keating
entries.text: MDK couldn't be satisified with one post (listed in last week's issue of the Perl Weekly), he had to post on the company blog, too. 'Cuz he's like that.

entries.title: London Perl Workshop 2017
entries.author: salvador_fandino
entries.text: Salvador also attended LPW, gave a talk, and had a great time!

entries.title: 4 Days in Amsterdam with Porters
entries.author: todd_rinaldo
entries.text: P5P held a Hackathon October 12-15. Todd reports on some of the key work, and teases us with more blog posts to come.

entries.title: CPAN Testers at meta::hack v2
entries.author: doug_bell
entries.text: Doug continues improving integration of CPAN Testers with MetaCPAN. He attended the second annual MetaCPAN hackathon, and here reports on his work at the event, along with a list of upcoming work.

entries.title: What's In a Name, (or How I Picked my Name-space, and Lived)
entries.author: john_scoles
entries.text: Choosing a namespace for a new CPAN module is non-trivial. John gives us some of his though processes for the work he's on.

entries.title: OpenCage Data, Geocoding in Perl
entries.text: The builtinperl.com folks interview Ed Freyfogle, co-founder of OpenCage Data about the work they're doing in geocoding with Perl.

entries.title: Perl 5's List-Flattening and Reference-Taking Design Choices
entries.author: aristotle_pagaltzis
entries.text: Aristotle tells us a bit about some of the design considerations in Perl 5.

entries.title: graphql-perl - Plugin to Make GraphQL 'just work' with OpenAPI
entries.author: ed_jordan
entries.text: This new plugin provides conversion from a given OpenAPI specification to a GraphQL schema.

entries.title: 2017.48 Community First
entries.author: liztormato
entries.text: The weekly roundup of Rakudo news.

entries.title: I've Written a Small BBC News Scraper in Perl 6
entries.author: st33znson
entries.text: After learning a lot about Grammars, st33znson has written up a small scraper, and shares it with us in this Reddit thread.

entries.title: YAML::PP Grant Report
entries.author: tina_muller
entries.text: Tina has been working hard on YAML-related work including presenting at the LPW. She reports on a number of improvements, and other grant-related activity.
